alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Sitka; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 5:59AM AKST until February 25 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low will move into the NE gulf Thursday evening with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday morning. Dry snow will begin in the Yakutat area, then spreading from north to south across the panhandle. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for the northern inner channels around Haines and Skagway. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 1 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Sitka, Port Alexander, Angoon, and Kake areas. * WHEN...From 1 AM Friday to 1 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry, snow will fall Thursday night then greater rates are expected Friday afternoon and evening. Some mixing with rain is likely near Port Alexander Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Sitka; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
